question: Explain what an API (Application Programming Interface) is and why it is important in software development.
correct_answer: An API is a set of protocols, tools, and definitions that allows different software applications to communicate with each other. It defines the methods and data formats applications can use to request and exchange information. APIs are important because they enable integration between systems, promote code reusability, simplify development, and allow developers to use third-party services without understanding their internal implementation.

question: Which of the following is NOT a valid Python data type?
Write a Python function to find the sum of all even numbers in a given list.
What is the purpose of version control systems like Git? List at least three benefits.
correct_answer: Version control systems track changes to files and coordinate work among multiple developers. Benefits include: 1) History tracking - maintains complete change history, 2) Collaboration - allows multiple developers to work simultaneously, 3) Branching and merging - enables parallel development, 4) Backup and recovery - provides restore points, 5) Code review - facilitates peer review process.

question: Describe the Model-View-Controller (MVC) architecture pattern and explain its advantages.
correct_answer: MVC is a software design pattern that separates an application into three interconnected components: Model (data and business logic), View (user interface), and Controller (handles user input and updates model/view). Advantages: Separation of concerns, easier testing and maintenance, parallel development, code reusability, and flexibility to change one component without affecting others.
